Yes, we can set your company up as a ‘client’ and we would bill your company; you would pay us, we would then pay the workers you have on project. The key part of this is the type of workers that you send us and the manner in which the rate is negotiated with them. We only work with workers who understand what it is like being a consultant or are willing to learn. Because we withhold both employer and employee taxes from the amount you pay us to pay the workers, they need to understand this would be the equivalent of them having to do their own taxes with their CPA.
All of our group benefits that would be offered to these workers are listed here: http://www.mbopartners.com/mbo-exec-group-benefits-2012. Once someone signs up the benefits begin the first of the month following the activation date.
Lastly, you do not have to run all your profit through us, you would simply pay the invoices for the workers compensation that you placed. Further, the workers would only be paid when you paid, no sooner. This is why it is important that they think of themselves like consultants (paid when paid).
Regards,
Steve

However, we are in the process of expanding our consulting business, and I like the option to have the consultants setup with MBO vs 1099. Also, when is the health insurance renewal date for MBO?
